seccommerce.secsignersigg
Class SecSignerExtOptions

java.lang.Object
  seccommerce.secsignersigg.SecSignerExtOptions

public class SecSignerExtOptions
extends java.lang.Object

The public options of SecSigner which are available for external applications.

Version:
$Id: SecSignerExtOptions.java,v 1.9 2012/01/20 14:52:05 hl Exp $
Author:
SecCommerce Informationssysteme GmbH, Hamburg

Parameters:

Method Detail

isAutoClosed

public boolean isAutoClosed()
Returns true if SecSigner automatically closes the card readers after processing a call to a signature function. Otherwise the card reader connection remains open and has to be closed explicitly by a close() call.

Returns:
true if the card reader will be closed automatically after signature

public java.lang.String getFilenamePresetSignedData()

Returns:
the file name preset for document files.

getDesiredHashAlg

public java.lang.String getDesiredHashAlg()
SecSignerMain does not set a desired hash algorithm unless this option is set. The Common Criteria certification requires this option to be "null" or a suitable algorithm.

Returns:
the optional desired hash algorithm for SecSignerMain

isPlainDataPosted

public boolean isPlainDataPosted()
Returns true if the plain data shall be posted to the server right after decryption without signing or verifying.

Returns:
true if the plain data shall be posted to the server

isSuffixReplacedInSignature

public boolean isSuffixReplacedInSignature()
Returns true if the original file name extension is replaced. False if instead the extension of a signature file is appended.

Returns:
true if the original file name extension is replaced.

isSignatureReplacementAllowed

public boolean isSignatureReplacementAllowed()
Returns true if SecSigner is allowed to overwrite an existing signature file with the same name.

Returns:
true if SecSigner is allowed to overwrite an existing signature file with the same name

isSignatureReplacementAutomatic

public boolean isSignatureReplacementAutomatic()
Returns true if SecSigner overwrites an existing signature file with the same name without asking.

Returns:
true if SecSigner overwrites an existing signature file with the same name without asking

isResignFilesInDirectory

public boolean isResignFilesInDirectory()
Sign files which have already been signed again?

Returns:
true if files which have already been signed should be signed again

getSaveExtractedOrDecryptedDocument

public boolean getSaveExtractedOrDecryptedDocument()
Returns true if SecSignerMain shall save the document if it has been extracted from signature or decrypted.

Returns:
true if SecSignerMain shall save the document if it has been extracted from signature or decrypted

allowEmpytDocuments

public boolean allowEmpytDocuments()
Allow empty documents?

Returns:
'true' if not all documents to be signed have to be submitted

isOcspMandatory

public boolean isOcspMandatory()
Is OCSP mandatory for signature verification?

Returns:
'true' if OCSP is mandatory for signature verification

setOcspMandatory

public void setOcspMandatory(boolean val)
Determine if OCSP is mandatory for signature verification.

Parameters:
val - 'true' if OCSP is mandatory for signature verification

isEmbeddedSignatureExtension

public boolean isEmbeddedSignatureExtension(java.lang.String extension)
SecSigner does not read documents for marked embedded signature extensions automatically.

Parameters:
extension - file name extension
Returns:
'true' if extension is associated with embedded signatures

setEmbeddedSignatureExtension

public void setEmbeddedSignatureExtension(java.lang.String extensions)
SecSigner does not read documents for marked embedded signature extensions automatically.

Parameters:
extensions - extensions associated with embedded signatures

isMailSignatures

public boolean isMailSignatures()
Return 'true' if an option should be offered to mail all signatures created.

Returns:
'true' if an option should be offered to mail all signatures created
